title: Attention: The Buckfast Easter egg is here and we’re SO ready for it
text:
(Picture: SWNS) Attention people, this is not a drill. I repeat, this is NOT a drill. 
10 ways to tell if your glass of wine is any good A Buckfast Easter egg exists, and our wildest dreams have finally come true.
A Northern Irish off-licence called D-Bees have started selling the tonic wine themed egg for £10.99 – with the option for £5 delivery if ordering from out of the country.
(Picture: SWNS) In store, the eggs have currently been reduced to £8.99 as part of the store’s ‘introductory offer’.
The tonic wine-fuelled 140g chocolate egg also comes with a free lighter and a pen, as well as a mini bottle of Buckfast – basically everything you need for an afternoon crossword session in a pub garden.
(Picture: SWNS) The store has received more than 2,000 orders of the Buckfast egg within its 24 hours of advertising.
More: Food There is now a ginger flavoured Pepsi Max and we can't quite imagine it 
A breastfeeding cafe is about to open - and they're looking for staff 
This Cardiff shop sells chocolate orange and lettuce sandwiches and people are losing it 
They were inspired to release the Easter edition of the egg after it was such a huge success during Christmas time – and it seems they really know their chocolate fans, as people are going totally wild for it.
The egg will be available to buy online from 3 April, though with the way things are going, you’re best to log on early just to make sure you get your hands on one (or two) before they sell out.
Are you a Scottish, or maybe just someone who is madly excited by all this? Let us know in the comments below!
